page.title: 04OLD ST. PETER'S, THURSO
page.content: The most interesting old building in our part of{Thurso}is{Old St. Peter's {Kirk.}A church was founded on this site in 1220 but present remains date mainly from the 17th century. The church was last used as a place of worship in 1832. A society called the Friends of Old St. Peter's, formed in 1963, raises money to preserve the roofless ruins. A large tracery window has been repaired and other work carried out as funds allow. The interesting old graveyard has a grave dating back to the 14th Century. However, most that were able to be read were from the 18th and early 19th Centuries. Today it is a tourist attraction in a pleasant part of old{Thurso}near the harbour and the river estuary.
